intro: Hesperantha pilosa, commonly known as the hairy bluebell, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple bell-shaped flowers. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Hesperantha pilosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
